backend

Class StorageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.StorageManager

  • public class StorageManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Global file management class used to handle all communication with and modification to the local file system.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Jacob Jones, Andrew Rottier

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StorageManager.CaseCreationResult
      Values representing the possible results of calling createCase.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Case> cases 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StorageManager()
      Calls the method that populates the cases ArrayList.

      Case.AddFileResult addFiles(boolean delete, java.lang.String caseNum, java.util.ArrayList<PeripheralIcon> selected)
      Accepts an ArrayList of PeripheralIcon objects, and attempts to add the files associated with them to the case specified in the parameters.
      private boolean caseExists(java.lang.String caseNum)
      Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not a case with the passed in case number already exists.

      Returns a Case ArrayList populated with all of the cases currently managed by PEMS.

      Generates an ArrayList of cases by scanning the managed folders on the current device.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getCases

        public java.util.ArrayList<Case> getCases()
        Returns a Case ArrayList populated with all of the cases currently managed by PEMS.
        Returns:
        Case ArrayList populated with all of the cases currently managed by PEMS

      • addFiles

        public Case.AddFileResult addFiles(boolean delete,
                          java.lang.String caseNum,
                          java.util.ArrayList<PeripheralIcon> selected)
        Accepts an ArrayList of PeripheralIcon objects, and attempts to add the files associated with them to the case specified in the parameters.
        Parameters:
        delete - boolean value indicating whether or not the original copies of the files to be added should be deleted
        caseNum - String containing the number of the case the files should be added to
        selected - ArrayList of PeripheralIcon objects representing the files to be added
        Returns:
        AddFileResult enum type indicating whether or not the add files operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameters are null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the selected ArrayList is empty

      • createCase

        public StorageManager.CaseCreationResult createCase(java.lang.String caseNum)
        Creates a case with the specified case number by making directories for it in the local file system. Also initializes a matching Case object and adds it to the cases ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        caseNum - the case number for the case being initialized
        Returns:
        CaseCreationResult enum type indicating whether or not the case creation operation was successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the parameter is null

      • retrieveCases

        private java.util.ArrayList<Case> retrieveCases()
        Generates an ArrayList of cases by scanning the managed folders on the current device.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Case objects representing all of the cases stored in the managed directories (/cases/backup/ and /cases/live/)

      • caseExists

        private boolean caseExists(java.lang.String caseNum)
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not a case with the passed in case number already exists.
        Parameters:
        caseNum - the case number in question
        Returns:
        true if a case with the passed in case number already exists; false if otherwise

      • validateCaseNum

        private boolean validateCaseNum(java.lang.String caseNum)
        Returns a boolean value indicating whether or not the passed in case number is valid.
        Parameters:
        caseNum - the case number in question
        Returns:
        true if the passed in case number is valid; false if otherwise
